comment: This professor is the man. The final and midterm are worth about 30% of your grade but everything else is completely online with answers easily available. He grades projects very very leniently. I would take him for every class if I could. Awesome teacher to have
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Most unorganized professor with insane workload. The only good thing is the extensions he would give for assignments. He also gives 2 Excel projects and gives no help on them, and just provides a YouTube video on how to finish them. Would not recommend unless you figure out pretty much anything on your own...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Professor North is very rude. I was confused with the course and the course material and when we spoke he blamed me for everything and said I should drop this course and take it again instead of actually trying to help me and clear up my confusion. Please stay away, if you value your education.

The teacher's generous extensions help manage the heavy workload, but the sheer volume of content, especially for the major exams, can be overwhelming. More exam-focused prep, like study guides, would significantly improve the course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Very generous with due date extensions!!!! I will say there is a lot of content and a lot of assignments to complete each week plus a decent amount of projects, but the weekly assignments are not due until the midterm/final so he gives enough time it's just a lot of material

If there is one professor I would recommend to anyone it's Professor North. I took IS2200 once previously with a different professor and his class was far better than my previous run. He is a LIGHT GRADER with big projects, responsive if you have questions, his quizzes were easy and straight forward. Take his class!
He was a good teacher but reading through his PowerPoints is a must!

Mostly a hands off professor, who gives grace periods for assignment which is a huge plus. Some assignments are bit hard to navigate, it was harder for me since i didn't reach out for help. Very gracious and clear with grading, it would have been easier if i made more of an effort to ask questions. Group project was fairly easy with a good group.

Almost half of the final grade in this class was 5 projects including an end-of-semester group project, but he is a super light grader as long as you try and follow the rubric. There is a midterm and final exam, each 15% of your final grade. They were alright, some of the questions copied from quizzes, which are all weekly and almost all open note.

When you have the group project, if you are the group leader, he will throw you under the bus when you have to give feedback about your group members. I gave honest feedback and when they were upset he sent to me to me tell them why I scored them so low. Put me in sticky situation.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: The professor was fine, but the organization, workload, and clarity of this class were horrible. There was a group project, individual projects, 19 closed note quizzes, and 2 closed note tests. The projects were fun and easy, however, the quiz and test material did not correlate well with the study material... imitating a stressful guessing game.
